intro: Crypsinus connexus, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses. It is a perennial plant characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in spikelets, typical of grass species. It thrives in moist, sunny environments such as wetlands and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
